verses.verse: But now <WH6258> they that are younger <WH6810> <WH3117> than <WH4480> I have me in derision, <WH7832> <WH5921> whose <WH834> fathers <WH1> I would have disdained <WH3988> to have set <WH7896> with <WH5973> the dogs <WH3611> of my flock. <WH6629>
Yea, <WH1571> whereto <WH4100> might the strength <WH3581> of their hands <WH3027> profit me, in whom <WH5921> old age <WH3624> was perished? <WH6>
For want <WH2639> and famine <WH3720> they were solitary; <WH1565> fleeing <WH6207> into the wilderness <WH6723> in former time <WH570> desolate <WH7722> and waste. <WH4875>
Who cut up <WH6998> mallows <WH4408> by <WH5921> the bushes, <WH7880> and juniper <WH7574> roots <WH8328> for their meat. <WH3899>
They were driven forth <WH1644> from <WH4480> among <WH1460> men, (they cried <WH7321> after <WH5921> them as after a thief;) <WH1590>
To dwell <WH7931> in the clefts <WH6178> of the valleys, <WH5158> in caves <WH2356> of the earth, <WH6083> and in the rocks. <WH3710>
Among <WH996> the bushes <WH7880> they brayed; <WH5101> under <WH8478> the nettles <WH2738> they were gathered together. <WH5596>
They were children <WH1121> of fools, <WH5036> yea, <WH1571> children <WH1121> of base men: <WH1097> <WH8034> they were viler <WH5217> than <WH4480> the earth. <WH776>
And now <WH6258> am <WH1961> I their song, <WH5058> yea, I am <WH1961> their byword. <WH4405>
They abhor <WH8581> me, they flee far <WH7368> from <WH4480> me, and spare <WH2820> not <WH3808> to spit <WH7536> in my face. <WH4480> <WH6440>
Because <WH3588> he hath loosed <WH6605> my cord, <WH3499> and afflicted <WH6031> me, they have also let loose <WH7971> the bridle <WH7448> before <WH4480> <WH6440> me.

Upon <WH5921> my right <WH3225> hand rise <WH6965> the youth; <WH6526> they push away <WH7971> my feet, <WH7272> and they raise up <WH5549> against <WH5921> me the ways <WH734> of their destruction. <WH343>
They mar <WH5420> my path, <WH5410> they set forward <WH3276> my calamity, <WH1942> they have no <WH3808> helper. <WH5826>
They came <WH857> upon me as a wide <WH7342> breaking in <WH6556> of waters: in <WH8478> the desolation <WH7722> they rolled themselves <WH1556> upon me.
Terrors <WH1091> are turned <WH2015> upon <WH5921> me: they pursue <WH7291> my soul <WH5082> as the wind: <WH7307> and my welfare <WH3444> passeth away <WH5674> as a cloud. <WH5645>
And now <WH6258> my soul <WH5315> is poured out <WH8210> upon <WH5921> me; the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> have taken hold upon <WH270> me.
My bones <WH6106> are pierced <WH5365> in <WH4480> <WH5921> me in the night season: <WH3915> and my sinews <WH6207> take no rest. <WH7901> <WH3808>
By the great <WH7230> force <WH3581> of my disease is my garment <WH3830> changed: <WH2664> it bindeth me about <WH247> as the collar <WH6310> of my coat. <WH3801>
He hath cast <WH3384> me into the mire, <WH2563> and I am become <WH4911> like dust <WH6083> and ashes. <WH665>
I cry <WH7768> unto <WH413> thee, and thou dost not <WH3808> hear <WH6030> me: I stand up, <WH5975> and thou regardest <WH995> me not.
Thou art become <WH2015> cruel <WH393> to me: with thy strong <WH6108> hand <WH3027> thou opposest thyself against <WH7852> me.
Thou liftest me up <WH5375> to <WH413> the wind; <WH7307> thou causest me to ride <WH7392> upon it, and dissolvest <WH4127> my substance. <WH7738>
For <WH3588> I know <WH3045> that thou wilt bring <WH7725> me to death, <WH4194> and to the house <WH1004> appointed <WH4150> for all <WH3605> living. <WH2416>
Howbeit <WH389> he will not <WH3808> stretch out <WH7971> his hand <WH3027> to the grave, <WH1164> though <WH518> they cry <WH7769> in his destruction. <WH6365>
Did not <WH3808> I weep <WH1058> for him that was in trouble? <WH7186> <WH3117> was not my soul <WH5315> grieved <WH5701> for the poor? <WH34>
When <WH3588> I looked for <WH6960> good, <WH2896> then evil <WH7451> came <WH935> unto me: and when I waited <WH3176> for light, <WH216> there came <WH935> darkness. <WH652>
My bowels <WH4578> boiled, <WH7570> and rested <WH1826> not: <WH3808> the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> prevented <WH6923> me.
I went <WH1980> mourning <WH6937> without <WH3808> the sun: <WH2535> I stood up, <WH6965> and I cried <WH7768> in the congregation. <WH6951>
I am <WH1961> a brother <WH251> to dragons, <WH8577> and a companion <WH7453> to owls. <WH1323> <WH3284>
My skin <WH5785> is black <WH7835> upon <WH4480> <WH5921> me, and my bones <WH6106> are burned <WH2787> with <WH4480> heat. <WH2721>
My harp <WH3658> also is <WH1961> turned to mourning, <WH60> and my organ <WH5748> into the voice <WH6963> of them that weep. <WH1058>
